Introduction to creating custom functions in R Sreeskandarajan Sutharzan 2020-09-03 1 About this workshop A gentle introduction to creating your own functions in R We’ll focus on Components of R functions Why do we need custom functions How to create a custom functions Types of custom functions Simple examples
2 Functions in R Functions are R objects which are used to create access manipulate delete other R Objects Hence, functions are key elements of R Examples vector() length() plot() ls() [] rm()

4 Temp This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/.
